Reviews.Title: “Worked for us as nearby residents waiting out home repairs...”
Reviews.Author: myounder
Reviews.Content: We had to vacate our nearby home whilst repairs were being done, for three days. We had a water-facing two bedroom suite on the fourth floor, for two adults and two kids. It was large and the added bunk bed we ordered was the best I've seen - nice and big and firm. Overall, the stay was very pleasant and the staff very attentive (the manager greated us each morning at our breakfast table). The dinner menu at the restaurant was better than average - the breakfast buffet was simply average. Also, despite showing espresso based coffees on the menu, they had none and weren't planning to replace their broken machine. So if you are espresso junkies like us, you'll have to hike to to Bloor Street for your coffees. The fitness centre is decent and clean. The beds were comfy and our room had new, large TV's. The parking lot is pretty tight and nearby traffic from the Gardiner Expressway and Lakeshore Drive can be heard (but you get used to it). If possible, seek our a water facing room. The other rooms are about 12' from the Gardiner Expressway. I can't imagine how noisy they'd be. But these roads make the hotel very accessible.

Reviews.Title: “After The Fees & Extras, It Was No Bargain”
Reviews.Author: JimDavisHouston
Reviews.Content: Stayed on Business. This Hotel was booked because it was assigned to me by the Customer. $12.00 per day for parking in an open, unsecured, “Park at Your Own Risk” lot is outrageous! I have to admit though, the room I had was very nice. I had been upgraded to a Deluxe room on the Lake side. The rooms on the Lake side have outdoor balconies, so if there are any Smokers reading this, the balcony would be convenient. The hallway smelled slightly musty, but the room was neutral. I didn’t detect any type of smell in the room. (Good, bad, or otherwise.) The room was quite large. Bathroom was nice. The beds were clean, and the mattress was firm. Very large flat screen TV with around 75 channels. Good quality picture that was easy on the eyes. Heat was effective and quiet. Large work desk, with convenient power outlets. Outlets were also available at bed side. Breakfast was at 6:30am. It was a nice buffet equal to the others, with eggs, breakfast meat, hash browns, and the usual continental items. Breakfast is usually free at the other Hotels I use, but this one cost me $17.00 per day. So, in the end, the room was nice, but after taxes and add on fees, the price was not.

Reviews.Title: “Recent stay was very good”
Reviews.Author: Glenn K
Reviews.Content: Over a two week period, I spend 7 nights at this hotel. I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the rooms and the restaurant. The hotel is not new, but the rooms have been upgraded and are clean and comfortable. The restaurant has a limited menu, but it is very good quality. The breakfast buffet is also very good and a good value. Finally, the hotel is a close to transit so you can be on the subway in 10 minutes or downtown by streetcar in 20. So, save money and stay here.

Reviews.Title: “We've stayed here before...”
Reviews.Author: OmaXthree
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here a number of times before, but were a bit concerned after we made our last reservations then read the reviews saying that the hotel had gone downhill. What we found was much the same as what we have come to expect at this particular location. Four Points by Sheraton on Lakeshore is located close to where our children live, so we often stay at the Four Points when visiting them. All of the staff at this Four Points were very accommodating during our stay. The room was clean though somewhat dated; but we didn't spend a lot of time there, so it was not a problem for us. We were on the lake side of the hotel, so noise was not an issue either, even though Lakeshore is a fairly busy thoroughfare as well. The $12 parking charge was quite reasonable for the location and considerably less than most other hotels. We will return to this hotel in the future..

Reviews.Title: “Good Concept”
Reviews.Author: Concierge34
Reviews.Content: After staying at the Fairmont York Hotel we searched for a hotel for a night. We called our friends in Turkey and they offered us this hotel. They made the reservation for us. We arrived late at night and we parked our car in front of the hotel. Reception was helpfull. There is a room just at the back side of the reception for internet and we used it as a free of charge. Room is larger than the one we stayed in Royal York Hotel. No bellboy, no doorman etc. like Hilton GardenInn concept. Good price, good location, large room and comfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has gone downhill”
Reviews.Author: milklady58
Reviews.Content: Used to stay here frequently, but will not again. They now have implemented a ridiculous $12 parking fee. For a non-downtown and non-airport location I find that unacceptable. The hotel is dated, only one elevator worked. The closet was so short I had to hang my pants in the bathroom. The bathroom vanity is tiny! Not enough room for even a toilet kit, let alone the blow dryer. Bath floor dirty. ONE pod of coffee per room. Wake-up call came 10 minutes late. The airport Four Points are much better choices.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, poor parking”
Reviews.Author: Lucy F
Reviews.Content: I found the front desk staff and the restaurant staff to be very helpful and accommodating, however the parking attendant is RUDE,RUDE,RUDE- very insulting man who should NOT be in the service industry and I have to say that lead to a frustrating experience. It doesn't help that the parking lot is small, not enough spaces for the number of rooms so ended up having to leave my truck in a different lot and cab it there which lead to extra costs. I did file a complaint with the front desk staff but have yet to hear back from management. This stay was not worth the price I paid for it. Next year I will be looking for another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Do not waste any money booking here”
Reviews.Author: ZHMontreal
Reviews.Content: This by far was one of my worst hotel experiences. Do not get me wrong the hotel itself is fine, the rooms are fine and clean but the location is terrible and the staff at is subpar and about useful as a self-check-in counter. Generally most people stay at hotel to catch some sleep away from home, or at least that is what I thought the concept is, this is not the case at this place. Do not be fooled by the stars, those are completetly made up this hotel is worse than a comfort inn or days inn hotel. You are better staying at one of those or a more expensive real "starred" hotel. The hotel itself is located about a ~20min drive to DT so that is why I chose it and for the price, however I should have stayed at a more expensive hotel as I ended up paying the same, or a cheaper one as you expect to comprimise for price . The first night my room was on the 3rd floor and NO exaggeration the highway was a meter away, I managed 2 hrs of on off sleep. The first thing I did after I had to given up all attempts to fall back asleep was ask for a room change . The only thing available "so they say" was a lakeview room for a $30 extra charge...I moved immediately, if it had not been the day of and I wouldn't have been charged that night anyways, I would have moved hotels. So in my superior lakeview room, that night I was up most of the night again with the parking attendants yelling at eachother to move cars in the parking lot chaos.- There are double if not more rooms, than car spaces so your cars are double or triple parked, not really an issue but that night again was awful. I also ordered in room service for dinner you are better off not eating or going to the gas station and finding something.. it was gross and for hotel prices def not worth it. In the end I learnt that this hotel should be ashamed to have the Sheraton name associated with it and that with all the extra momney I spent with upgrading and cabs, I should have stayed in a more expensive hotel or even a less expensive one closer to town and not overlooking highway.NEVER AGAIN at this hotel. I generally don't complain about things like this but in two nights I managed 6 hrs sleep, less than and average night.

Reviews.Title: “it was great except for.....”
Reviews.Author: carolscafe
Reviews.Content: the front desk and hotel staff were amazing. However, the next morning in the on-site restaurant, the wait staff were rude and uncommunicative.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, accomodations were average”
Reviews.Author: cuberican
Reviews.Content: Loved the location, across the street from the lake. The hotel is pretty old. The rooms are nice, but the exterior areas were looking rather worn. No room service after 10pm. No gift shop where you can buy snacks. All they had was a vending machine and I was out of Canadian money. Neither the front desk or bar could break at $10 US bill, so it was a very long night. I would not stay here again - there are a lot of better choices in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer02_84
Reviews.Content: Overall this hotel was better then my expectations for it. I was unsure of booking it due to some of the reviews on here but i took the chance and was glad we did. The hotel was clean, easy to get to and the location from downtown was also good. They upgraded our room which was very nice and the staff was friendly and bubbly which is always nice! The room was smaller then typical hotel rooms but bright, clean and not noisy at all. We faced the water, parking lot and Lakeshore blvd (which constantly had traffic) and it was still quiet. We would come back to this hotel for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Possibly the noisiest hotel I've ever visited”
Reviews.Author: MysteryLodger
Reviews.Content: The rooms are neat, clean and very well appointed. The outside of the builiding looks like a motel and is a bit off-putting. The on-site food services look ok, but not appealing enough that I would eat there if there are other choices within a 30 minute walk. Just typical hotel food.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: TracyOOttawa_Canada
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Four points this weekend for 2 nights. The hotel was clean and the rooms were a good size and the bed was VERY comfortable. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience!!”
Reviews.Author: C P
Reviews.Content: Stayed over the Saturday night for my significant others birthday. Enjoyed the view from balcony. Room was extremely clean. Room services was very quick and responsive and front desk was very helpful. Was a great stay and have already had other friends stay there as well and all has gone perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a nice place to stay - Just don't have a room in back”
Reviews.Author: WNY_Voyager
Reviews.Content: Just remember when booking ask to stay on the lake side. The other side is a stone's throw away from the QEW/Gardner express way and if you have one of those rooms don't expect a great night sleep. The best part of this hotel is right across lakeshore, a beautiful park with great walkways and a perfect view. There is free parking in lot but no good access to public transportation from hotel so you either drive to where you have to go or take a cab. Gym is good size with variety of equipment. Restaurant is pricy but good food. The bar is one of the smallest I've ever seen. The room itself was nice with The people were very friendly and we had no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Won't be going back.”
Reviews.Author: LaRoyal
Reviews.Content: Four Points that I remember: My room on the second floor was a stone's throw from the QEW. - the speeding cars were EYE LEVEL with my windows. The noise was unbelievable. I tried to change my room but they said the hotel was full. The other side of the hotel faces Lakeshore Ave. and Lake Ontario. Probably not as noisy and there could be a view. I thought, OK then, this room is awful so I will go to the Lounge and enjoy a beer while I wait for my friends. NOT! Bar, lounge and restaurant (all the same place and not the least bit attractive) are closed from 1:30 pm to 4:30 pm on a SATURDAY. Now, if there were plenty of bars around that you could walk to on a sweltering summer day, then that would be OK, but no such luck. It's the ONLY one in the entire area. This lounge is advertised as being open ALL DAY from 4:30 on. What the heck? To add insult to injury, each time I walked by the closed glass doors, I spotted staff in there quietly chatting and wiping glasses. And each time I rode the elevator, I was tantalized by a beautiful ad for Craft beers.... sigh. The cost to have a beer delivered to the room, not including tip, would be $17. So, later on, I had a great outing with my friends and when I got back that night, the highway noise was so deafening and depressing that I packed up my stuff and drove home, luckily only an hour away. OK... the rest is standard hotel fare, my room was tiny, with worn furniture, poor decor, nothing to get excited about, but it's clean and the staff are friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience here”
Reviews.Author: CentralNY0
Reviews.Content: Just stayed this week at this hotel. I was really pleasantly surprised by it when we got there. First, bring your bikes with you (my son was smart enough to do so, and he biked around the city). Right across the street is an amazing bike/ inline skate boardwalk that goes along the lake, with a special bike/pedestrian bridge. It's quite long, and my daughter & I didn't get a chance to walk it all (there's a walking part separate from the biking part). Really nice! They now have BIXI bike rentals, but we didn't do that. The hotel is outside of the downtown area, but was the perfect location for us. Parking was fine, never had a problem finding a spot, and the hotel was alot nicer than I thought it would be. The beds were so comfortable that even though the kids would set alarms for 7AM, they were too comfy to get out of bed before 10! The view of the lake was very nice. With it being summer and trees in full bloom in the park across the street, it was somewhat obstructed, but it was still a nice sight. The room was not noisy at all. With us being on the lake side, there's a street right out front, but I always keep the room's fan or AC on for "white noise" anyway, so we didn't hear a thing. The balcony was nice in the morning to bring my tea out & relax before starting the day. The staff was so very accommodating and helpful. Our fridge didn't work, which apparently was the case with other rooms. No big deal- we loaded ice in a bucket to keep drinks cold. We didn't have baby bottles or medicine to keep cold, so not a priority. My son called down to let them know of that, & asked if there was a microwave he could heat up something in. Within 10 minutes we had a microwave oven delivered to us- at night. This was really above & beyond. It really helped out, as we went to the grocery store & got micro meals that we ate (& saved $$ by doing). It was more valuable than the fridge! They didn't have to do that, & it was appreciated. They were very helpful in the tourist questions that I asked. The free WiFi was great (I saw alot of hotels in the city charged a fee for parking & WiFi). I purchased online tickets to Second City and was able to print them in the Business Center in the lobby, which was nice. I highly reccommend taking in a show there- my 19 & 22 yr old kids loved it as much as I did. We used the green public parking lots, which was cheaper than the subway or buses. Never had a problem finding a spot. The hotel is only a few miles to the CN Tower, Entertainment District, etc. Just go right down the Lake Shore Rd that's in front of the hotel, and it will take you most of the way. We parked at the Harbourfront ($12 for the day), and walked to the Entertainment District, CN Tower (great tour also), along the Harbor. I also reccommend the Distillery District (public parking again), and check out the shops, galleries and eateries in those buildings. It's a very charming place that they've made out of an old area. The sculptures around there are really nice, too. Also only a few miles from the hotel. The hotel room was a nice size-we had the double beds on the lake side, which are larger than the queen beds on the highway side. Nice in-room safe which our computers fit into (after reading another person's review tipped me on this), and the closets had alot of room as well. We didn't go into the bar or restaurant- the prices seemed steep, but it seems everything around the city was expensive anyway. The location was perfect, as we were outside the downtown area, but still in the city. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Poor”
Reviews.Author: Jena12
Reviews.Content: They over charge you for things you dont even use. I got charged 50$ for food I never even ordered.

Reviews.Title: “4 points hotels with a 5 star view”
Reviews.Author: Umski
Reviews.Content: Now this is one hotel with an excellent view of lake Ontario. It's 15 minutes away from Pearson and Billy Bishop airports. Very popular and fills up on the weekends. Comfortable, clean rooms; living room type lobby; nice restaurant and bar; and great staff. Access to Toronto City Center by street car ( a short walk away); convenience store and small eateries on Windemere Ave. and Lakeshore gardens at its doorstep makes for a very convenient stay. Breakfast spread is good and reasonably priced - but monotonous in its daily offering ( I assume most people don't stay here too long to notice). Lunch and dinner too gave me no reason to complain.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Awesome Staff Would Recommend to Others”
Reviews.Author: Antaya
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to Ontario Place, the CNE and downtown. There is public transportation near by for those who dont wish to drive. All staff that we came in contact with were pleasant and professional. Upgrades are currently being done throughout the hotel. Took advantage of the restaurant and bar - menu was excellent and had a variety for everyone's taste. Would definately recommend and stay here again

Reviews.Title: “I would never stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: wkkVancouver
Reviews.Content: First, they could not find my reservation. Second, clerk was slow and seemed clueless about finding me a room. Third, sheets on the bed were so worn, I could have ripped holes in them with a simple tug. Fourth, the door to my outside balcony did not lock! If I had not been so tired I would have been scared to death. Fifth, the walls were paper thin and I could hear the men in the next room talking loudly until well past 12:30 am. Sixth, I thought breakfast was included with the room; it was not and cost $15. All in all--a terrible experience and I would never stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Good - but needs some updating!”
Reviews.Author: IceTrey
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel feb 4th 2011 for two nights. For travel to Toronto this hotel is our first choice as it is central for everything we want to do. Not to mention the great prices and the parking which is free! Over the past three years we have stayed here numerous times and always have been completely satisfied with the hotel and the great service the the staff always provide. This past trip is one I want to comment on as it did not live up to the previous stays. We booked through expedia and received at great rate for the stay. We were upgraded to a lake view room which was a bonus due to the size difference. We were pleasantly surprised to see the bathroom had received a makeover and was beautiful! However the two double beds were not what we had in mind. Front staff more than willing to help us out and provided a more suitable room. King size bed was a comfy of a bed that you could as for.. However the pillows were a little woren but nothing a couple more couldn't fix! The bathroom in this room was the downside! It was old and outdated and Tub was bleach stained and covered with either paint or caulking.. Either way it was truly the downside and may be what influences our decision for accommodations in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Mouse droppings in both beds”
Reviews.Author: ACDBurlington
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks nice from the outside, modern and clean. The rooms look nice but things start to fall apart when you look a little more closely. We checked under the pillows on both beds of our lake facing room and found plenty of mouse droppings. That turned us right off. Management gave us a new room, a single bed room on the back side of the hotel. All the rear side rooms are within 20 feet of a major highway. The roar of the traffic prevented any sleep that night. I would stay away from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: copper71
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located near public transit for those who don't want to drive. A bit noisy for those in rooms on the north side. All staff that I came in contact were very friendly & from what I saw the hotel was in great condition. The only downside was the bird dung covering my van in the morning. My advice is not to park under the trees in front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “As a travel agent I would recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: RoadMooreTravelled
Reviews.Content: My one night stay at the Four Points can only be described as pleasant. Based on the room I stayed in I would stay here again in a heartbeat. I did not nor have not read any of the reviews because I needed to be in this location for a specific event at this end of the city. The front desk staff couldn't have been nicer. Check-in was quick and easy and a new umbrella was procured in an instant when I requested one. I chose a king bed room with partial lake view and got one on the second floor. I could see the lake clear as a bell from my room so I am uncertain if the partial was accurate. There were trees but it was fall so no leaves. Perhaps in the summer, with leaves and 4 lanes of traffic, the view is more obstructed? The bed was very comfortable, the soft goods (comforter pillows etc) were modern and clean as were the two chairs facing the coffee table. The room safe was big enough for my 17" laptop (free wireless internet is advertised and it was amazingly fast in my room) the t.v. was a huge, perhaps 42" ? LCD modern unit with great sound. I found the room to be quiet even though we faced busy Lakeshore Blvd. All fixtures worked and nothing was in disrepair. The bathroom reflected the age of the hotel. It's small- built for one - and you won't find any marble here. But it was clean and had some amenities like hairdryer, lotion/shampoo/conditioner. Small, not fancy but clean. Oh, and If you are going to whine because there is only one elevator and sometimes it is going to be busy or that ice is only available on the first and fourth floors, don't stay anywhere. Just stay home. You really shouldn't be travelling. : ) I needed to be in the west end instead of downtown so the location was perfect. I looked up other choices and was truly thankful to have a decent hotel at this end of the city. As always, the room prices range dramatically depending on when you stay. In my own opinion I would be happy to have this quality in Toronto, for a king bed room for $159/$169 ish a night but the hotel is popular for the Royal Winter fair, the Cdn National Exhibition etc. so there are peak season prices and it is a Toronto hotel. If you judge a hotel on exterior appearance this hotel may not suit you. From the exterior is looks it's age but the inside has been kept up nicely. I wouldn't want to be in a room on the Gardiner highway (Expressway) side because I am a light sleeper but when I called the hotel they explained that only the queen bed rooms are on that side. Those rooms are at a lower cost so you get what you pay for. The ceiling in my room was not pretty. It looked like it had been repaired in patches by someone who didn't know what they were doing. lol. Again, if you care about that then you are really fussy and shouldn't stay here. Our room had a balcony which was a welcome way to get some fresh air. It had 2 plastic chairs which were - well - plastic. Not fancy but just fine. The surface of the balcony has suffered from age and it's exposure to the lakefront I suspect. I would hope the hotel has plans to put down some outdoor tiles to pretty it up but I wasn't sleeping on the balcony. I was sitting there for 20 minutes to relax before going out. The fitness center looked compact but well suited to someone to whom the fitness centre is not the be-all and end-all of their stay. For 3/4 of the year you could run/walk along the lake path right across the street from the hotel. Also, due to events, I did not have time to eat in the hotel but the food I saw being consumed as I waited for a cab certainly looked appealing. Hopefully other guests have reviews. I hope your stay is as pleasant as mine.

Reviews.Title: “well the bed was comfy....”
Reviews.Author: luvdaniel
Reviews.Content: well, the room was tiny, the bedspread literally smelt like 5 day old stale crotch, I had to throw it in the closet or die from the smell. The window faced a major road, so I get to hear a constant hum of traffic. not a pleasant thing to try and sleep through. the internet connection in the room is terrible.....i'm writing this review from the room and i've had to reconnect about 3 times to do it. nuff said. the parking lot.....LOL. if you plan on parking, keep the spot......because you will lose it. they don't have enough parking, I was out for a bit and came back....the parking attendant had to park us almost on top of another person in one of the exits! he also mentioned he needed to fit 8 cars there! I have a rental with me, and won't be too pleased if it gets damaged. Guess i'll find out in the morning. This place is not worth the price. stay somewhere else

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant suprise”
Reviews.Author: bobbyjoe145
Reviews.Content: After looking around Toronto for somewhere too stay (most places where pricey), we happened upon the Four Points...................What a suprise, the cost was reasonable we opted for a upgrade to a lakeshore room, I was a little disapointed with the view, as our room was above the reception enterance, so it was a little restricted. The front desk staff and the bar attendant where very attentive and helpful, our room was a decent size, the bed was very comfortable, we both had a great nights sleep. The free parking was a great bonus. I would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Upgraded & all was good!”
Reviews.Author: CDB1976
Reviews.Content: We had read the reviews & were a little skeptical. The doorman was very friendly. Check is was fast! The "free" room upgrade was nice! The room was very big & clean. The bed was really comfortable. We got a phone call 5 minutes after being in the room to ensure everything was ok. We arrived back in the room after midnight & the traffic wasn't so bad. In the morning you could hear it, but in the middle of the city what can you expect? All & all it was a great room, for a great price & we'd stay again in a minute!

Reviews.Title: “WOW-one of (if not THE) worst SPG stays ever”
Reviews.Author: phillyphlyer40
Reviews.Content: Where to start????? Checkin-nothing above the regular bonus points for Platinum member. (Flyertalk.com has reports of free breakfast for Plat members, I can tell you that I was told by 3 different staff members "NO!") Did get an "upgrade" to a lakeview room. Although since they were sold out-my single king bed room became a 2 twin bed room! The room looked like it hasn't been refurb'ed in 10+ years! Smells of bleach and musty carpet were overwhelming. The bathroom looked like someone took a 5 gallon pail of caulk and slopped it all over. The best part of the whole stay was that it was only one night. I will not be back.EVER.PERIOD.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: solotraveller03
Reviews.Content: Last weekend I stayed at the Four Points Lakeshore and from the time I entered the hotel I felt at home. The service at the Front Desk was outstanding as well as in the Lounge. My room was small but considering the rate it was more than adequate. The rooms facing the lake were larger but since I was only staying one day I decided on the less expensive room. The room was clean and well maintained. I definitely will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Mice”
Reviews.Author: marktrek
Reviews.Content: Booked for Dragonboat weekend in Toronto. 2nd night woke to find a mouse trying to get into a closed bag of popcorn. I chased it away, packed quickly and had them move us to another room. Also considerable road noise and they were not going to offer compensation for our inconvience. I finally suggested they remove a dinner from the bill, which apparently they have done.

Reviews.Title: “Only a stop over stay perhaps hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marsha_2010London
Reviews.Content: I think this hotel seems very nice from the outside and the reception was very well kept. I have stayed here during my grandfather's funeral. I am from UK However, the rooms and service remains to be desired. First and foremost housekeeping or reception when asking for basic items makes you feel like you asking them for a big favour. On one occasion I asked reception for an adaptor. The receptionist gave me one and said this is all that they had . It was unfortunately obvious that it had a three prong and not two. I had to explain to the reception how can this fit and he agreed it wont for Canada. The room is very clean and spacious. However, it had tea making facilities and coffee maker. However, there was no kettle. We asked housekeeping for one and it did not arrive. We then had to ask housekeeping again after another night's sleep and they gave us a brand new. I think a nice kettle would make the room more comfortable as a pot of tea is $7CAD. Also it would be nice to have proper teacups. Paper cups will disintegrate with hot water being poured into it. Free wifi in room - excellent.

Reviews.Title: “FIne hotel, but...”
Reviews.Author: JaredAWasser
Reviews.Content: it looked much better in pictures than actually being there in person. Is that something against them? No, but just caught my eye as soon as we pulled up. There was nothing wrong with our stay, but I am very easy going when it comes to hotels. For $180 a night, I did expect more (being it was the most money I have ever spent on a hotel). The hotel building was clearly old. We did spend the extra money to get the lakeview room, and I guess we could have gone either way. Can't really see that much of the lake anyway. Pros: Good location (5-10min ride to downtown) Free Parking Easy to locate Free Internet Cons: Nothing special Old looking Expensive

Reviews.Title: “A Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Baba082
Reviews.Content: The hotel was kind of a disappointment. First of all, make sure to pay extra for a room facing the lake, otherwise you're looking and listening to a highway, the noise of which bothered us all night. Usually in a hotel some pride is taken in the level of cleanliness. Here, it seems to be lacking. The tub tiles looked dirty and there was a lot of rust, and the bathroom fan made a loud noise. Our first night, the bed sheet had a suspicious stain on it, so we removed it and had the bed changed the next day. We decided to try the room service, since there seems to be no other restaurants within a decent walking distance. Exorbitant price, just for some fruit and turnovers, which didn't taste good at all. The coffeemaker in our room was dirty as well. After that we stuck to the supermarket. On the day we were to check out, a girl knocked on our door at 8 am ready to clean our room. Check out is at 12 and we were still sleeping. After that we felt more than ready to leave and never go back.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at ALL costs!! Horrible hotel.”
Reviews.Author: mp2304
Reviews.Content: We just stayed here recently and usually always stay at Starwood Hotels (typically in Niagara Falls). I must say this hotel was a complete disappointment. The bathroom is dirty looking and there were spiders around the window. The greatest disappointment came AFTER checking out... I happened to forget an expensive shirt behind and called the day after checking out to find out the shirt was "not there". Clearly the housekeeping stole my shirt. When I called and spoke to the front desk they put my through to housekeeping who said "they found nothing and would contact me after checking the room", I did not receive a phone call and had to call back. I continued to get the run-around, and housekeeping would not answer when I called back the next day. The manager gave the typical answer that "there was no proof that housekeeping stole my shirt". I felt as though I was just annoying by calling and asking them about my shirt. Nice to know if you happen to forget something behind that it will go "missing". DO NOT STAY HERE...there is nothing memorable about this hotel!! I still cannot get over the horrible service I received, but I guess that was because I was no longer staying at the hotel. I will never ever return back to this hole-in-the-wall. Hopefully the thief gets caught.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bustraveler71
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Four Points Lakeshore from May 10-15, 2010. Great hotel, staff are friendly, restaurant food is good, location is superb, and most importantly rooms are amazing! Closest hotel to exhibition enter made it easy for me to get there. I recommend this hotel to all business and leisure travelers as it has lots to offer for both kinds of travelers.

Reviews.Title: “run down”
Reviews.Author: shinoON
Reviews.Content: On the booking form it stated a "newly renovated " room, I didn't know what this "renovated" looked until I spoke (on the last day) to another resident of the hotel who was in one of the new and truly "renovated" rooms...acceptable and decent! I tried two rooms, the first was really bad and the second was slightly less bad. Both the rooms were basically run down. When I arrived in the first room, the receptionist, called straight away called and asked if the room was OK, although not trilled with the room at first look, I hadn't had time in the room to find out why such a call would be made so quickly.... I soon found out. When I tried to hang my clothes up, the door to the cupboard doors almost fell off and it was too small to hang up things properly. When I opened the curtains and he was eyeball to eyeball with the drivers on the highway. I called down and got a new room, but they said it was at extra cost. The new room was better, but I soon discovered various insects... including black ants in the shower & on curtain,and I received a bite from something on the first night, yuk! In the room I found small bits of glass in the carpet. I couldnâ€™t get a decent nights sleep because of a red light that blinked on and off every 5 seconds and filled the room with light. These aren't problems with the housekeeper or the staff, you don't get mold and bugs like this because it isn't cleaned. The fridge and TV are old, donâ€™t work properly and are neglected, the infrastructure needs work.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: PaulQuinn
Reviews.Content: The hotel basically does what it says! The hotel is based upon the lakeshore, with a freeway on bothsides. Ask for a room on the front of the hotel, as rooms as the back of the hotel are within touching distance of the freeway. The rooms are generally quite good, nothing fancy. The room does offer wireless broadband free which is a good thing. The hotel has a gym which is very basic, one treadmill, however you can simply cross the road and run along the lake which is a lovely run first thing in the morning or last thing at night. The location is quite good. Traffic in Toronto is generally very busy, and a cab ride will cost between 20 and 25 dollars, taking between 15 to 30 minutes. Food, generally ok. All in all, could be alot worse and alot better. Average.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints!”
Reviews.Author: Serenity31
Reviews.Content: My experience was very positive. I traveled to toronto for 4 days with my friends to attend the Caribana festival. Daily rate was very good and check-in/check-out was quick and problem free. Rooms were clean and furnishings adequate. Parking was free with plenty of space available. We were also within walking distance to the lake and to a streetcar that takes you downtown which we used when we didn't want to be bothered with parking. Would have no problem staying here again, but I suggest that if you're someone who likes to be "in the middle of the action" then I would suggest staying closer downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Bugs and ok food hotel”
Reviews.Author: ella3338
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my husband and three kids to Toronto. When we got to our room, we noticed that the washroom was filthy. The rest of the room had dead bugs carcasses everywhere. Many stuck in spider webs. It was disgusting!!! Upon complaining, the manager came and inspected the room and moved us to another room which was ok. The food in the restaurant was not the best or even close but hey...

Reviews.Title: “Unless you get a lake view room do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: emcman
Reviews.Content: I flew in from the west coast on a quick business trip. My room was on the 4th floor.(465) I had no idea until after dinner that is a few feet away from an elevated 6 lane highway that runs directly by the hotel. You can see their faces as they drive by. The window does not seal out the sound at all and some truck were compression braking. I know the hotel can not move but better sound proofing is needed. I stayed in a hotel in Seattel right above I5 and they placed sound machines in each room that could play nice sounds to mask the car and truck noises. They also placed a card in the room and said there was some sound and even offerred ear plugs. This was on the 12 floor. In Toronto it was almost directly outside the window. Best to admit and face the issue than ignore it. The hotel seems to have a newer and older part. The bed was fine storage good. The bath has no area for your supplies so you put down the lid and use that. Servcie from the time I was there was good but I slept maybe an hour. I did not pay for the room as it was business related but I think it was around $200 US. I would consier the other side but there is a four lane road there bit it is not an expressway.

Reviews.Title: “They damaged my vehicle - Park at your own risk !!”
Reviews.Author: geanaisha
Reviews.Content: It's funny, I thought the view of the hotel was faboulous. What I didn't find so cute what the parking. I arrived and parked my vehicle front out. I left it there and went clubing by taxi for the night. My car was blocked in by several vehicles. I was double parked. I found scratches on my beautiful sports car and the hotel so conveniently says they have no footage of the incident. INteresting no?! I book hotels for people all the time I'm a travel agent. This was by far a very bad experience and I found the staff very cocky and proud. The service I received in the beginning was excellent, the service to the end of the stay when my credit card was charged was horrible. If you must go to this hotel, take a taxi, or park at your own risk and leave with dents and scratches on the car like you've been to African Lion Safari. PLEASE NOTE THERE ISN'T any valet service, but someone may be driving your car if they run out of space.

Reviews.Title: “A nice get away”
Reviews.Author: A1teacher
Reviews.Content: We used the GPS and had no trouble locating the hotel. Parking is an issue, but we always were able to find a space. We brought our bikes and the hotel is located just across the street from a great bike path. We loved riding along the lake. A very relaxing time. WE stayed in two room. First was a King on ground floor. We heard no noise from the lot. IT was a beautiful room. It had a newly remodeled bath with a large shower. Very nice. WE upgraded to a suite for the last 2 nights of our stay. This room was older. The bathroom was not as nice as the one on the first floor. It also had a queen bed and a pull out bed. This room was on the other side of the hotel and there was noise from the highway. We loved sunnyside park across the road. It was great to hop on the bikes right from the door of the hotel and hit the trail. We enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “good stay”
Reviews.Author: bro12345
Reviews.Content: the only problem we had was that we requested a lake view which we got but the big four points sign blocked majority of our view. we asked to switch and they did this with no problem 15 minutes later. hotel parking was free but was very packed, may take a minute or two to even get a spot. outside downtown core but still close enough to alot of great areas.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't sleep...at all”
Reviews.Author: trvlwrldgrl
Reviews.Content: Considering this hotel is no where near downtown Toronto, the base price of $137 is ridiculously expensive. The room was TINY with little space to walk around in between the two of us. You couldn't even close the bathroom door & sit on the toilet at the same time, that is how small it was! The hotel is very old, but they are trying to say it is recently renovated. I saw no signs of renovation, other than the massive construction going on next door (perhaps that is what they mean by renovation). The worst part of the stay was our inability to sleep. The hotel is situated between the Gardiner Expressway & Lakeshore Blvd. Both are VERY busy roads/highways with loud traffic. Unfortunately, the windows are not upgraded to sound proof from the noise. Thus, it was impossible to sleep. While the hotel staff tried to be very accommodating, it almost bordered on annoying. We weren't impressed to get near hourly phone calls from the front desk asking us if everything is okay (and it wasn't okay). The only salvation is that we only had to stay one night at this hotel. I've never been more glad to leave a hotel in my life!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Toronto hotel”
Reviews.Author: bullsFan061
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Four Points by Sheraton while in Toronto for a business trip. I really enjoyed my stay there and thought the hotel staff were hospitable and accommodating. The hotel is located conveniently close to a major highway so this was very helpful for me to get to my meetings. All rooms had free access to Wi-Fi Internet, which was great as I was able to catch up on my emails while in my room. The hotels beds were very comfortable and I got a good night sleep every night I was there. Also, the steak and apple pie are a must have at the hotel restaurant. Lastly, the hotel was very clean, and the dÃ©cor around the common areas as well as the rooms was unique. Upon my return to Toronto, the Four Points would be my first choice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing & frustrating - don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Banshee22
Reviews.Content: I booked the "Romance Package" for $195 as a special treat for my husband's birthday. This was supposed to include a lake view, king bed, sparkling wine, chocolate truffles, in-room movie, and breakfast buffet. The first sign of a problem came during check in. I think I was the first person to ever book the "Romance Package." Every desk clerk we dealt with during our stay (3) had NO IDEA what the package included, and had to spend several minutes reading the description on their computer screen. I had to watch all the staff read the details of our package over and over again because nothing was ready for us - I had to ask for each and every thing that was supposed to be included. The first desk clerk that checked us in was very friendly, and cheerfully told us that our room with 2 double beds was ready. When I said that I specifically booked a king room, she had to stop and read the information, and whoops! She was looking at the wrong name on her screen - we were indeed in a king room. Our "lake view" room was very generously named - it was on the ground floor, looking out on the parking lot. I could catch a glimpse of the lake if I stood on tip-toe. I could also enjoy the conversations of everyone who parked in the lot right outside our room - even with the windows closed the voices came through clearly. Who needs tv? My husband went to the front desk to request a room on a higher floor. There was a new desk clerk, who tried to go through the computer to find a new room, but was put off by the manager who stood behind her with her arms crossed repeating "No! No! No! No! No other rooms!" over and over. Surprisingly, the clerk was unable to find another room for us. The room itself was mediocre. The bathroom did not have any counter space, and only 1 drinking glass, which I found odd. The hotel also advertises "free bottled water!" Which consists of 1 500 mL bottle. I indicated double-occupancy when I booked - why only 1 glass and 1 bottle of water? We went out for dinner, and when we returned to the hotel around 9 pm we stopped at the desk to request that the sparkling wine and truffles be sent to our room, and to confirm that the breakfast was included in our rate. Cue another several minutes of watching the desk clerk read the computer screen. Again, this is a package that the hotel advertises on its website - it might be worthwhile to let the staff know about it. The wine was delivered promptly, and the manager also dropped off the certificate for the breakfast buffet. We never did receive the chocolate truffles, but by this point we were full from dinner and couldn't be bothered to ask, AGAIN, for something that should be included in our package. We watched a movie ("Angels & Demons" - pretty good!), as per our package deal, and called it a night. The next morning we found that our checkout summary had been slipped under the door of our room - and showed a charge for the movie. Which should have been included in our PACKAGE. I called the front desk, and surprisingly the clerk was ready for me this time - she said the movie was on there in error and had already been removed from our charges. Score one for the hotel. We went to the restaurant for our breakfast buffet. The service was lacklustre, and the food was pretty bad. Reconstituted eggs and stale pastries. The manager did come by twice to ask if everything was all right, and if we enjoyed our stay (a different manager than the "No! No! No other rooms!" lady from the night before). I was disappointed in our stay. I could handle the less-than-stellar room location, or having to follow up on every single thing that was supposed to be included in our package, or the bad food, or the rude manager, or the lone drinking glass, but all together they added up to a bad night. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone, and definitely DO NOT book the "Romance Package"!

Reviews.Title: “Comfy Beds, Good Service”
Reviews.Author: yarn_addict
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while having surgery in Toronto. I found the staff accommodating, and the service great, particularly the restaurant staff. The hotel backed onto an expressway, but we had a lake view and didn't hear a thing. I booked this hotel because of other reviews about the beds being comfy and they really were. I also read that the place smelled. I didn't believe it but when we went in the room it did smell a little like the kitchen. It seemed to get better after a while and it wasn't that bad. The price was good for this room and the stay was good overall. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “COMFY BEDS”
Reviews.Author: bedhead02
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Points Toronto Lakeshore for two nights in April 2009. Check in was smooth and friendly. The room was spacious enough. The bed was great. There's no noise from the traffic outside and crossing the road is ok if you wait for the sign. The breakfast buffet's not the best value but the service is fair. The trams are regular for travelling.

Reviews.Title: “Third stay here...still loving it.”
Reviews.Author: GreeneKing
Reviews.Content: I was at the Sheraton Four Points in 2005, 2007 and 2009, and will definitely book in there on my next visit. First off, I think they have the most comfortable beds I ve ever slept in, slept like a baby every night. I know several people have complained because it's near the highway, but I found the highway noise to be mild and neutral, and you can't hear it at all if you tunr the fan on in your room. The breakfast buffet is plentiful and fresh, and the restaurant has a nice atmosphere. I can't say enough good things about the staff there. What a delightful bunch of people! The restaurant manager remembered our large party frm two years ago and was very gracious and helpful. The bar tender offered us directions and shortcuts to avoid rush hour traffic downtown. And the woman who cleaned our rooms was very friendly and funny, and has an amazing memory, after one day she knew which room each member of our 15-person group was in.Finally as we were checking out, the man at the front desk said to my friend (who was suffering from a cold/sinus thing the day we checked in) "I hope you are feeling better now."

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfy beds.”
Reviews.Author: summafunmum
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights during the CNE through an internet promo offering three nights for the price of two. It worked out to $110 per night, which I felt was very reasonable for peak season. Although nicely decorated and upgraded, it should be noted that this is a very old property. So if you like fresh and new and modern, don't bother. But if you don't mind a little charm, then this hotel is just fine. Also, there is no swimming pool. There is a hot tub in the gym but our kids were disappointed that they couldn't swim. The rooms are spotless; the super-comfy beds are dressed in the traditional Sheraton duvets with feather pillows and soft sheets. (Although a request for a couple of foam pillows was granted, no problem.) Our room was on the second floor overlooking the parking lot, and we could see the lake--across the four lanes of traffic on Lakeshore Drive. A bit of a disappointment, but at least we weren't at the back of the building which looks onto the Queensway. We had a balcony with a couple of chairs and a fridge as well. Although we encountered two problems during our stay here, both were rectified to our satisfaction. The first was a lack of parking. When we arrived back at the hotel in the evening, every spot was full and cars were double, and triple parked! We were asked to leave our keys with the front desk and they would only move our car if need-be. We awoke the next morning to find our vehicle nicely tucked into a parking spot, just below our room. The second problem was a party of young guys in the room next to us. After a request by my husband for quiet fell on deaf ears, we contacted the night manager who promptly came up and "rectified the situation" (we heard him giving the guys a stern talking-to) and we also received a follow up call from the manager to make sure all was well. (It was.) Despite these annoyances, we would stay here again. The location is convenient to the CNE, the lake shore, downtown and the airport. The rooms are clean and nicely decorated. The beds are amazingly comfortable and the staff was polite and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “What a smelly place!”
Reviews.Author: OntarioMeave
Reviews.Content: We read all the mixed reviews on this hotel before booking, but they were very mixed, so we assumed it must have been that some folks went in expecting too much. I have to say I was sorely mistaken. The complaints about the smell were not overdone. The front lobby had a pleasant fruity type fragrance but, the hallways had a very old musty smell, and the rooms were so overpowering in the smell of some sort of floral cleaner or freshener that I had a headache within seconds of walking in and felt nauscious soon after. The walls were severely water stained and the wall paper was peeling in our room, there was no fridge, despite the fact that our booking included "premium bottled spring water" -none provided. Our room did have a balcony from which you could see the lake, but just barely as the hotel is only 5 floors high and the lake is across the four lane road and park. There were also no chairs that you could sit on to enjoy what view there was. There was absolutely a high definition flat screen TV in our room, but who goes to a hotel to watch TV? We booked a King room, the one plus is that the bed was enormous and extremely comfortable. We only had one glass in our room, kind of funny when a room with a king bed would normally be double occupency. When we requested a second glass we had to explain why we needed one before they agreed and brought one up. Note that we explained that we wished to have a glass of wine and were expecting wine glasses, but they brought water tumblers. We also discovered that despite booking a late check out of 4 pm our check out time was in their computer for noon and could only be extended until 1 pm. This wasn't a big problem though as we had no desire to remain any longer than we needed to. Upon our check out I noticed that the bill didn't quite match up with what had been quoted on line. When I asked about it we were informed thta there were some phone calls made on our phone. I clarified that we had only used the phone twice and both times for local calls. The girl behind the counter explained that yes, those were the charges for local phone calls. $1.70 per local call. I'm sorry, but that is just ridiculous, charging for a call that costs them nothing! We paid the bill and made it clear that we were not happy and would never book there again. The girl behind the counter did not seem phased by this at all. This is not a hotel I would recommend to anyone for any reason.

Reviews.Title: “Not Quite Lakeshore!”
Reviews.Author: MalmoFitandfun
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for four nights hoping to enjoy a lakeshore hotel close to Toronto down town. The hotel is in fact located between the busy Lakeshore Boulvard and the Gardner Expressway. The Lakeshore is streching the imagination as the Lakeshore boulvard is a six lane dual carriageway! Thev rooms are to a good standard as one would expect and the staff particularly helpful and cooperative. The Lake view room has a balcony but the noise and dust created makes it pretty unpleasant. The hotel also has a major construction project immediately next door. The Buffet breakfast was adequate if uninspiring. The tram is about 10 min walk and provides a good 24 hour service to down town. It takes at least 45 mins. The other option of a bus to th the subway, but the buses are infrequent and the journey about the same time.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, but several major drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: paxxy
Reviews.Content: I had a generally okay stay at this hotel although I likely will not go back again. As other people have said, the hotel is literally several feet away from the elevated freeway and cars zip by the 3rd floor window. The noise level varies from barely noticeable to extremely loud depending on your exact location and floor, so cross your fingers and hope you get a good room Good: - Nice staff - Newly renovated rooms have updated bathrooms and furniture - Fairly close to downtown by car Bad: - Some rooms very loud due to proximity to freeway - Rooms very small. - No counter space in bathroom at all. I had to leave items outside on the bed and walk back and forth between the sink and the bed. - Not enough parking. Throughout all the days I was there, the number of cars exceeded the number of available spaces. Guests were forced to double up on spaces and leave their keys with the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Bad for Business Travel”
Reviews.Author: hellghoti
Reviews.Content: Disappointing! It is right on the lake...but it is also right next to Gardiner Expressway. Rooms were dirty and run down. Food at breakfast was wretched. On the last night of my stay, I was awoken at 3 AM by a group of dozens of high school age kids talking loudly in the lobby. After repeated calls to the front desk had no effect, I just got up and checked out to catch an earlier flight. The manager and staff were friendly and helpful and sympathetic. But also not very effective. Not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Have stayed here maybe 4 or 5 times over the past few years”
Reviews.Author: spykitten
Reviews.Content: We always book rooms with balconies (for fresh air) but this hotel is pretty clean (non smelly). It's far from the lake (4 lanes of traffic) but I like the lake view. Also this hotel is far from downtown... a $17 cab ride away. If you are hungry you can go across near the lake to the BBQ stand for a hot dog or burger. There's nothing else within walking distance. If you drive in the opposite direction (North) you will eventually come to Bloor (No Frills grocery store is there). One drawback of this hotel: lately there is another building being constructed right beside it, so you might hear some construction noise really starting early in the morning. There is a computer in the lobby with free internet access but I found some of the customers to be hogging it and pretty pushy if they see you using it and they want their turn. Literally this one woman would not let me use it for an entire 5 minutes and demanded that I step aside so she could use it immediately. It seems that the majority of guests here were tourists in groups or business people from out of town. I didn't ever see any families with children. One final drawback: one time two of us each had our credit info stolen from this hotel. I guess one of the clerks or cleaners had a skimming machine to copy the numbers. Totally we had >$17k + $4k of fraudulent purchases, which seemed to come from taxi drivers because they had a lot of charges from gas stations and tire shops.... so I don't entirely trust the staff nor the taxi drivers outside. The credit card companies didn't make us pay and the hotel sent us a coupon for a free 2-night stay as an apology.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place - In the Summer”
Reviews.Author: UKJamesB
Reviews.Content: Check-in was smooth and good and the room was modern. The position is excellent overlooking the lake. The hotel is a little out of the main centre though but the plus of free parking makes up for it. I was there over the unusual snowstorm and so could not actually see the lake for several days - I imagine it is a great place to be in the summer though. The food was reasonable but the steak although highly recommended as ' the best in the world' - was far from it - certainly does not compare with Argentinian or even South African beef. Toronto is very much an immigrant city and while I applaud companies that maintain equal opportunity placements - I would recommend they work on their employees accents (all did speak perfectly good English). I particularly found the Indian accents almost impossible to understand and on several occasions had to actually physically come down to reception to understand what was being said.

Reviews.Title: “Don't recommend this hotel at all”
Reviews.Author: peigirly
Reviews.Content: I absolutely would not recommend this hotel. I arrived late on my first night, and first of all could not find one single parking space. I parked my car at the front door, went in, checked in and asked where I was to park. Someone came out and directed my to a little spot and had to squeeze in a small corner between a couple other vehicles. During check in, I was told my room was facing the highway and for an extra $20 I could get one across the hall and away from the highway. Since I didn't really know how close it was to the highway or even exactly what highway he was referring to I declined, thinking how bad can it be. Well, I walked in my room and the noise was absolutely incredible. It sounded like the room was sitting on the highway. I looked out the window and even though it was dark, I couldn't believe how close it was. Even at that hour, the highway was busy and very loud. I called down to the front desk to say I wanted that other room after all, but it had been taken apparently. So I turned on the TV to drown out the noise and the TV wasn't working. Went in to the bathroom and I think it is the smallest hotel bathroom I've been in. There is absolutely no place to put any toiletries as there is a small pedestal sink, no counters, no shelves. If you need to use the toilet, you must close the bathroom door, otherwise anyone passing outside will hear you. You can touch the door to your room from the toilet. After a night of hardly any sleep due to the noise from the highway, I called to see if I could get a different room for the second night of my stay. No luck. I had also asked for a wake-up call at 7:30 a.m. and even though I was up, the call didn't come until 7:45. I also called to report the TV not working. The next night I again arrived late and not one parking spot. They said they had closed an entrance and for me to park in the entrance. I went out and the entrance they referred to was not closed so I had to go back in and tell them it wasn't closed. They then sent someone out to put cones there so I could park. I was not happy at this point - it was one thing after another with this hotel. I finally park and go to my room and my room key fails to work. After several attempts I have to go back down and have them re-program my key. Luckily the TV was working and the highway traffic wasn't quite as loud (although still very loud) and I was able to sleep better. In the daylight I looked out the window and just could not believe how close the hotel is to the Gardner Expressway. It can't be more than 20ft. or so. Also, the phone closest to the bed did not work, but free bottled water was provided and the bed was comfortable and the room was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: DJDouglass
Reviews.Content: My tour group stayed at this hotel for 2 nights and found it to be quite adequate. The rooms are roomy with all the features most of us like--good tv, refrigerator, comfy beds. I had a good view of Lake Ontario from my room. The hotel is quite accessible, service is good. The attached restaurant is certainly adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Great reception staff. Hotel is nothing special.”
Reviews.Author: olig
Reviews.Content: Great reception staff. Nice big bed, although the room was nothing special. Sink in the bathroom was cracked. Location is quite far from the city. Ok if you have a car. There's a tram stop not to far away too. Busy road runs right next to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was ok, room was very bad”
Reviews.Author: globetrotterboy
Reviews.Content: Being a Starwood Gold member I was first of all expecting an upgrade. Unfortunately, this did not happen. We received a room on 5 meters away facing the highway 401 bridge, so you could hear all cars passing by at night and we were not able to sleep at all. We complained but the hotel was fully booked due to a wedding reception. We complained to the general manager (left voicemail) but diod not recieve a reply untilafter we left. We decided to only stay that night and then went to the Westin Harbour Castle. Cannot recommend due to poor service and very poor and small rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Could easily be a 9/10...”
Reviews.Author: paulbail
Reviews.Content: The Four Points is a very nice hotel. It's close to the city, the staff is superb, the room was nice and clean. The bed sheets smelled great and the bathroom was very clean. The only problem is if your room is on the Gardiner Expressway side. We knew that it could be a problem, since it was mentioned in some reviews, but we figured that it shouldn't be that bad...The noise was intense! We did bring some ear-plugs, just in case, and we used them. That was the only down side. I feel that paying around 100$ a night and having to wear ear-plugs is disappointing. But again, as soon as we put our plugs we had a nice night. It's up to you, because all the rest was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice cozy hotel, good value and location”
Reviews.Author: brade270
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel mid Aug/07 and were very impressed. We were with a wedding group and got a rate of $150 a night, which I thought was very reasonable. It's a very small hotel, with only 5 floors, but the rooms are very nice and we were happy with the service we got at the hotel. When I got to the hotel, they were going to put me on the second floor, but I requested a higher floor so I would have a better view of the lake. The hotel had no problem switching this for me, and moved me up to the 4th floor. It was well worth it, as we got a great view of the lake. My parents were staying on the second floor and didn't get that great of a view because the trees were tall enough that they blocked the view of the lake. The hotel doesn't have a pool, but it does have a great fitness centre, as well as an area with a hot tub, sauna and steam room that are nice. The hotel also has two computers that you can access the internet from. One is in the lobby of the hotel, and the other is in the business centre just around the first corner to the left of the lobby (you just have to ask at the front desk for an access key). The only meal we ate at the hotel was breakfast. It was very good. They had a buffett breakfast which I believe was about $12 a person. The hotel doesn't have a airport shuttle service, but the hotel called and set one up with one of the companies that do it. It was a flat rate of $38.00. You could also take a normal cab to the airport, which they estimated would be about $32.00. We just wanted to be safe though, and make sure we had a set rate, as we were going to the airport first thing in the morning when it was really busy as everyone was going to work.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and relaxed”
Reviews.Author: jbritishtraveller
Reviews.Content: the rooms are superb,When they finally found our booking, Most of the staff outstandingly helpful,the Hotel facilities really good , BUT, if you do not have a car with you,the Hotel is a bit out of the city,and involves using public transport which though fun,takes a while to get you into the city. Would recommend you purchase a multi transport card(saves a fortune) On the whole this Hotel is to be recommended to anyone wishing to visit the city,but prefers a nice quiet area to sleep in

Reviews.Title: “Comfy beds”
Reviews.Author: epoirier
Reviews.Content: What drew us to this hotel was proximity to the CNE grounds where we wanted to be and the free parking. Check in was easy and quick. Our room was on the first floor which really marred any view of the lake as it was hard to look out over Lakeshore Blvd. Next time I would ask to be on an upper floor. The room was lovely at first glance. But in the bathroom, we had ants!! I've never had an ant problem in Canada in the cold winter so I don't know where they were coming from. I wanted to complain but hubby didn't so I put up with them. I mentioned them to the maid and asked that she try and do something. Whether she did or not, I don't know as they were still there when we came back later. The heat didn't seem to work the first night but it was 21C in the room so we weren't cold under the down comforter. Next day the heat was on, so maybe we just didn' t know how to work the thermostat. Parking was free but they do have limited spots. When we came back Saturday evening around 11:30pm, there were no empty spots. I had to go in and ask staff what to do. I guess it is a common problem as they asked me right away if we couldn't find a spot. What they did for us, was pylon off one of the driveways so we and about 4 other patrons could park. We didn't eat here as prices seemed high. We will likely stay here again if we need to be close to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Some good, some bad at the Four Points Lakeshore”
Reviews.Author: slc95
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a weekend trip into Toronto. Normally for leisure or personal trips I bid for a room on priceline unless I need to stay at a specific hotel or near a specific place. This time however, I chose to stay at the Four Points Lakeshore because I wanted to get my bonus for Starwood points. First of all, if you do not have a vehicle and will be using public transportation, do not stay here. If you want to be close to the action of Toronto, do not stay here. If you want a hotel with a view of Lake Ontario...stay here only if you can't afford to stay at the Westin Harbour Castle. If you want to be close to Exhibition Place for the CNE or a convention, this is a good spot to be. Check in was the worst part of this stay and was one of the worst check in experiences I have ever had. They had 2 people already waiting at the Starwood Preffered Guest check in counter and only one at the regular counter, so I waited there. It took at least 10 minutes for the person in fromt of me to get checked in and when I finally got to the counter I wasn't offered even a simple apology for the wait. Then, I waited another 15 minutes for MY check in. The clerk had to ask for my credit card and address 3 times, even though I booked the hotel online through the Starwood site. Then she mumbled something about not being able to find a room. During this time she at least was somewhat cheery and apologized once or twice. After the long wait, no further apology was given or reason for delay was offered. I didn't expect any compensation, but having to wait a half hour to get checked in when there is only one person ahead of you is ridiculous. I am not exagerrating on these times, either. I arrived in the parking lot at the hotel at just after 5pm (I remember because I stayed in the car to finish listeming to the afternoon news report) and the clock in the room read 5:33PM when I got in...I made a note of it. I was placed on the top floor (Strarwood Preffered Guest floor) of this 4 storey hotel on the lake side. The view wasn't bad but was somewhat marred by Lakeshore Blvd that runs between the lake and the hotel. I don't remember really hearing much noise from the road in our room. The room also had a balcony, however it was closed for repairs. It was January anyway, so no big deal. The bed was very comfortable and was a King as requested. I love the Starwood beds (Sweet Sleeper, Comfort, and Heavenly) and the Four Points Comfort bed here was no exception. I am pretty sure they're actually all the same beds and I'm seriously considering buying one the next time I'm in the market. Room service was ordered and was fantastic but was rather expensive, even for room service. Check out was much smoother than coming in and no surprises were on the bill. Since I try to stay with Starwood hotels when I have the choice, I'd prefer to stay at the Westin Harbour Castle if I needed to stay in this part of Toronto but I'd rather stay at the Sheraton Centre if I wanted to be downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Far, far away...”
Reviews.Author: AstroJunq
Reviews.Content: Ok, I assume that the biggest mistake was mine: I went to this hotel without a car. The only time I go to Toronto by train, I decide to stay here. Bad choice... This hotel is very far from downtown, so even if it does cost a little less, the taxi fares will make up for the difference. Letting that part go, the room didn't live up to the other Four Points I've been to, like in Kingston for example. I had the same "noise" issues as some of the other reviewers. The lakeview was good though, can't really complain. The restaurant was very bad... We had breakfast in there and it was not a good experience. The buffet had few choices, we had to ask for an omelette as if it was something special and the staff was very unfriendly, with an attitude that looked like they were doing me a favor by being there. I would definetely NOT recommend this one, specially in Toronto, where you have so many other (better) choices.

Reviews.Title: “Double-Glazing salesmen would have a field day here.......”
Reviews.Author: ThePoppitts
Reviews.Content: I can't believe some reviewers have stayed at the same hotel - we sincerely question the 5 star status......... At check in our room had actually already been given to someone else - using our name!!! Needless to say we questioned them about making sure they didn't charge this to our credit card too!!! We eventually were allocated a room on the 4th floor and when we walked in the traffic from the Gardnier Expressway was so loud we thought the windows were wide open. Imagine our surprise when we saw the "double glazed" windows were shut tight!!!! What a racket! The room was fairly small, and the bathroom was made for miniature people :-( but the bed was one of the most comfortable we have ever slept in :-) Another negative was how thin the walls were. Lucky us - we had noisy neighbours on both sides of our room - one due to their loud TV and the others due to loud other "indoor sports" we don't want to mention - especially at 3am. We used the spa section and it was utter rubbish. The whirlpool didn't work at all, the shower was broken, the steam room was switched off and the sauna was far too cool, with no ladle or bucket of water for the coals. Great!!! We ate at the restaurant and the food was very nice. The service was okay too but it was all a bit pricey by the time you finish paying taxes etc. The hotel was quite far out of town but the trams were quite frequent, which was lucky. All in all we would never stay at this hotel again - the least they could have done was invest in good solid triple glazing so their guests can get a bit of sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: jm06hc
Reviews.Content: Ended up here on a Saturday afternoon, as our booked hotel turned out to be disgusting. Staff and management at 4 Points were awesome, willing to take us with no reservation on a busy weekend. Rooms are a great size, very clean, very well decorated. Great restaurant downstairs with reasonable prices. Amazing stay for the money. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good value on lakeview side!”
Reviews.Author: ScookumGirl
Reviews.Content: My partner and I enjoyed our stay at the Four Points Toronto. At $145 per night, the lakeview room with balcony was good value compared to Toronto centre prices. You do look over a four lane lakeshore road before you see the lake, but it was still nice view (from the 3rd floor kind of obstructed by trees, from the 4th floor excellent). Easy access to walking along the lake shore trail was also a perk. The rooms were nicely appointed, with good beds and bedding. All staff were friendly and helpful and we checked in about 6 hours early (we intended to store our bags, but our room was ready). Staff in the restaurant were unfriendly, service was slow, and food wasn't great value for the prices they charge. We ate out after our first breakfast experience. Transit (city trolley) was 1 blk walk away and it took about 20-30 minutes to get downtown, depending on traffic. Fairly convenient since trolleys came every 10 minutes. Overall the hotel was pretty good value, but not as upscale as their website suggests.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: keatingclan
Reviews.Content: I can't believe I'm staying at the same hotel that the other reviewers did. The room is very small and the restaurant is below-average. I love my view of the Gardner Expressway, which is literally fifteen feet outside my widow. On the other hand, front desk staff is great and the price is much better than downtown hotels. I bet the view on the lake side of the hotel is great, but I wouldn't know for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: ShabbyChique
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised at how great this hotel was. The staff were friendly and accommodating and I was thrilled to see that free parking was offered to hotel guests (a great find when you're in Toronto!) One down side to the parking though is that there are limited spaces available. If we returned to the hotel after 9 or 10pm, most nights there was no parking left and we were left to improvise. We were given a complimentary upgrade to a Starwood Room because I am a member of the hotel's loyalty program. Our room was clean, spacious and well-appointed. We had a lovely view of Lake Ontario and despite what others have posted on this page, the noise from the traffic on the Lakeshore was barely audible. The hotel offers free local calling and high speed internet. Our king-sized bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was also very clean and stocked with plush, fluffy towels. Four Points Sheraton Toronto Lakeshore is a bit off the beaten path in the sense that it is between Toronto West and Downtown. There are no shopping or eating locales (other than the on-site restaurant) around the hotel, unfortunately, due to its location. However, a quick 5 minute drive up Windermere Avenue to Bloor West Village offers up great shopping and eating possibilities. Or just hop on the Lakeshore and it will take you right into Downtown where you can shop and eat to your heart's content. My one complaint: check-out time is 11am and housekeeping kept bothering us to clean our room. They knocked on our door twice on the morning of our departure - once at 9:00am and the next at 10:20am. We had a late night before and were trying to sleep in a bit, so this was a real annoyance. The price was definitely right for this property. If you don't mind having to drive in to Downtown and maybe having to search out somewhere closeby to eat, then you'll really enjoy staying here. The hotel's proximity to the Gardiner Expressway also made it super easy to get back to the airport for our flight. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beuatiful Hotel Room”
Reviews.Author: randomhotelinspector
Reviews.Content: As loyal Starwood guests, we were happy to be upgraded to a Suite at this hotel, which turned out to be one of the nicest rooms I have ever stayed in. A full sitting room, with a seperate bedroom, and 2 full bathrooms. It was a lovely room. The service was also excellent, and the room service breakfast was on time and delicious. Parking was free and convenient, and the staff were helpful and knowedgable about the city. Noise from the highway not an issue.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for almost a week. Based on previous reviews I had noted carefully my reservation requirements, and it turned out I had to threaten to leave if they did not give me a room on the fourth floor with a balcony. Well the fourth floor was closed so I ended up in 357 and from then on it was a perfect stay. I was up at 6 for a run along the lake - well lit and safe. There was free parking, free internet, the cleaning staff were there all day and nothing was a problem for them. The gem turned out to the the restaurant - they would cook you anything you wanted even if it wasn't on the menu. The chef tried to outdue himself each morning with an omelette. The regular breakfast was very good with all the fresh, ripe clean fresh fruit you could possibly want. The restaurant staff were some of the friendliest people I have ever met. The fitness room is small but it was all I needed as I had the lakefront to myself. The steam bath actually works. I looked very carefully and there are no rooms on the Gardner Expressway side so I don't know where that one came from. They all face the lake. Mine was quiet and most nights I slept with the balcony door open. I met the owner who lives on the 5th floor where we had our meetings. The 5th floor is where the conference rooms are. They also have a huge terrace overlooking the lake which must be fantastic in the summer. I think it is an underrated hotel and I will certainly go back. Very comfortable and the bill came in about one third of the cost of staying at the Hilton on Univeristy Ave where I usually stay.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable - it was what I expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Don't stay on the Gardiner Hwy side - the noise will be unbearable. I stayed in room 359 which faces the lake and it was acceptable. No highway noise. My room had a balcony which was ok. The room was clean - bathroom sink needed to be replaced but it was not a show-stopper for me. Rooms and hallway had a bit of a chemical cleaner smell but it was minor. Restaurant was sub-par and not good value for money. But, I would stay there again because my friends live nearby but if I were a real tourist then I would look for something closer to downtown.
